questions.prompt: At which venue did Igor Stravinsky’s ballet The Rite of Spring receive its world premiere?
questions.explanation: The Rite of Spring premiered at the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées in Paris.

questions.prompt: On what date did The Rite of Spring premiere in Paris (world premiere)?
questions.explanation: Stravinsky’s ballet premiered on 29 May 1913.

questions.prompt: The Original Dixieland Jass Band’s “Livery Stable Blues” (often cited as the first commercially released jazz recording) was released on which date?
questions.explanation: The Victor release date is 7 March 1917 (recorded 26 Feb 1917).

questions.prompt: Miles Davis’ “So What” is a classic modal jazz tune. Which mode underpins the A sections?
questions.explanation: The A sections sit in D Dorian (with the bridge moving to E♭ Dorian).

questions.prompt: Beethoven’s Symphony No. 3 “Eroica” is cataloged as which opus number?
questions.explanation: The Eroica Symphony is Symphony No. 3 in E♭ major, Op. 55.

questions.prompt: Mozart’s Symphony No. 41 “Jupiter” carries which Köchel (K.) number?
questions.explanation: Symphony No. 41 “Jupiter” is K. 551.

questions.prompt: J.S. Bach’s Mass in B minor is cataloged as which BWV number?
questions.explanation: The Mass in B minor is BWV 232.

questions.prompt: Arnold Schoenberg’s Pierrot lunaire is which opus number?
questions.explanation: Pierrot lunaire is Op. 21.

questions.prompt: Penderecki’s Threnody to the Victims of Hiroshima (originally titled 8’37”) is scored for how many string instruments?
questions.explanation: It is famously scored for 52 strings (24 violins, 10 violas, 10 cellos, 8 basses).

questions.prompt: Messiaen’s Quartet for the End of Time was first performed under extraordinary circumstances in 1941. Where did that premiere occur?
questions.explanation: The work premiered at Stalag VIII-A, where Messiaen was interned as a POW.

questions.prompt: Who performed the premiere of John Cage’s 4′33″ in 1952?
questions.explanation: Pianist David Tudor premiered 4′33″.

questions.prompt: Benjamin Britten’s War Requiem was commissioned for (and premiered at) the consecration of which building?
questions.explanation: War Requiem premiered for the reconsecration of Coventry Cathedral.

questions.prompt: Samuel Barber’s Adagio for Strings is an arrangement of music from which work?
questions.explanation: Adagio for Strings comes from Barber’s String Quartet, Op. 11.

questions.prompt: Wagner’s Der Ring des Nibelungen cycle contains how many music dramas (operas)?
questions.explanation: The Ring comprises four works: Das Rheingold, Die Walküre, Siegfried, and Götterdämmerung.

questions.prompt: Alban Berg’s opera Wozzeck is based on an unfinished play by which author?
questions.explanation: Wozzeck is based on Büchner’s play Woyzeck.

questions.prompt: Maurice Ravel composed the piano original of Pavane pour une infante défunte in which year?
questions.explanation: Ravel wrote the piano Pavane in 1899 (orchestrated later).

questions.prompt: Schubert’s “Great” Symphony in C major is cataloged as which Deutsch (D.) number?
questions.explanation: The “Great” C-major Symphony is D. 944.

questions.prompt: Haydn’s Symphony No. 94 is commonly known by which nickname?
questions.explanation: Symphony No. 94 is the “Surprise” Symphony.

questions.prompt: Chopin’s two piano concertos are numbered Op. 11 (No. 1) and Op. 21 (No. 2). Which concerto was composed first?
choices: Piano Concerto No. 2 in F minor, Op. 21
Piano Concerto No. 1 in E minor, Op. 11
Neither: both were orchestrated after Chopin’s death
questions.explanation: Despite the numbering, the F-minor concerto (published as No. 2) was composed first.

questions.prompt: Rimsky-Korsakov’s symphonic suite Scheherazade carries which opus number?
questions.explanation: Scheherazade is Op. 35.

questions.prompt: Miles Davis’ album Kind of Blue was recorded primarily at which studio (famous for its church-like acoustics)?
questions.explanation: Kind of Blue was recorded at Columbia’s 30th Street Studio in NYC.

questions.prompt: The famous jazz standard “Take Five” was composed by which member of the Dave Brubeck Quartet?
questions.explanation: “Take Five” was composed by alto saxophonist Paul Desmond.

questions.prompt: Coltrane’s “Giant Steps” is notorious for rapid key changes following a cycle that moves by what interval?
questions.explanation: “Coltrane changes” famously cycle through key centers a major third apart.

questions.prompt: Ornette Coleman’s The Shape of Jazz to Come was released on which label?
questions.explanation: The Shape of Jazz to Come was released by Atlantic Records.

questions.prompt: Which movement comes third in John Coltrane’s suite A Love Supreme?
questions.explanation: The four movements are Acknowledgement, Resolution, Pursuance, Psalm.

questions.prompt: “Take the ‘A’ Train,” long associated with Duke Ellington, was composed by whom?
questions.explanation: Billy Strayhorn wrote “Take the ‘A’ Train.”

questions.prompt: The first jazz work to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music was Wynton Marsalis’ Blood on the Fields. In what year was the prize awarded?
questions.explanation: Marsalis received the Pulitzer Prize for Music in 1997.

questions.prompt: Which song was the very first music video played on MTV at launch (Aug 1, 1981)?
choices: “Video Killed the Radio Star” — The Buggles
questions.explanation: MTV launched with “Video Killed the Radio Star.”

questions.prompt: Which song set (and held for years) the Billboard Hot 100 record with 19 consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2019?
choices: “Despacito” — Luis Fonsi & Daddy Yankee ft. Justin Bieber
“One Sweet Day” — Mariah Carey & Boyz II Men
“Uptown Funk!” — Mark Ronson ft. Bruno Mars
questions.explanation: “Old Town Road” led the Hot 100 for 19 weeks in 2019.

questions.prompt: Who produced Queen’s “Bohemian Rhapsody” (from A Night at the Opera)?
questions.explanation: Roy Thomas Baker produced “Bohemian Rhapsody.”

questions.prompt: Nirvana’s “Smells Like Teen Spirit” was produced by which producer?
questions.explanation: Butch Vig produced Nevermind, including “Smells Like Teen Spirit.”

questions.prompt: The iconic guitar solo on Michael Jackson’s “Beat It” was performed by whom?
questions.explanation: Eddie Van Halen played the solo on “Beat It.”

questions.prompt: The Rolling Stones “tongue and lips” logo (first used in 1971) was designed by which graphic artist?
questions.explanation: Designer John Pasche created the Rolling Stones tongue logo.

questions.prompt: As of the 2024 awards cycle, which artist is credited as the most frequent (main-artist) winner of the Grammy Award for Album of the Year?
questions.explanation: Taylor Swift has the most Album of the Year wins as a main credited artist (four).

questions.prompt: Which tuning system name refers to the (typically) five-tone scale used in much Javanese and Balinese gamelan music?
questions.explanation: Sléndro is the common five-tone gamelan tuning system (pélog is typically seven-tone).

questions.prompt: In common-practice harmony, a “Neapolitan” chord is built on which scale degree (as its root) in a major/minor key?
questions.explanation: The Neapolitan is a major chord built on the lowered second scale degree (♭II), often in first inversion.

questions.prompt: Which mode is represented by the white keys on a piano when playing from E to E?
questions.explanation: E to E on white keys yields the Phrygian mode.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is the correct scientific pitch frequency for standard concert A4 in the ISO 16 standard?
questions.explanation: ISO 16 specifies A4 = 440 Hz as standard pitch.

questions.prompt: Which instrument is a double-reed woodwind pitched lower than the oboe, associated with the French name “cor anglais”?
questions.explanation: The cor anglais is the English horn, a lower-pitched member of the oboe family.

questions.prompt: In twelve-tone (dodecaphonic) terminology, what does “retrograde inversion” mean?
choices: The inverted row in reverse order
The original row transposed down a tritone
The original row in reverse order
The inverted row starting on the same pitch as the prime form
questions.explanation: Retrograde inversion is the inversion of the row presented backwards (reverse order).
